para.sentence: Set \gamma=\tau\sigma and define \phi_{n}(t)=\sqrt{\frac{2n+1}{2\tau}}\sqrt{\Lambda_{n}}\mathsf{Ps}^{0}_{n} \left(\frac{t}{\tau},\gamma^{2}\right), if n=0,1,2,\dots, \Lambda_{n}=\frac{2\gamma}{\pi}\left(K_{n}^{0}(\gamma)A_{n}^{0}(\gamma^{2}) \right)^{2}; see §30.11(v).

\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}e^{-\mathrm{i}t\omega}\phi_{n}(t)\mathrm{d}t=(-\mathrm{ i})^{n}\sqrt{\frac{2\pi\tau}{\sigma\Lambda_{n}}}\phi_{n}\left(\frac{\tau}{ \sigma}\omega\right)\chi_{\sigma}(\omega), \int_{-\tau}^{\tau}e^{-\mathrm{i}t\omega}\phi_{n}(t)\mathrm{d}t=(-\mathrm{i})^ {n}\sqrt{\frac{2\pi\tau\Lambda_{n}}{\sigma}}\phi_{n}\left(\frac{\tau}{\sigma} \omega\right), where \chi_{\sigma}(\omega)=\begin{cases}1,&\mbox{$|\omega|\leq\sigma$},\\ 0,&\mbox{$|\omega|>\sigma$}.\end{cases } Equations (30.15.4) and (30.15.6) show that the functions \phi_{n} are \sigma -bandlimited, that is, their Fourier transform vanishes outside the interval [-\sigma,\sigma].
The sequence \phi_{n} , n=0,1,2,\dots forms an orthonormal basis in the space of \sigma -bandlimited functions, and, after normalization, an orthonormal basis in L^{2}(-\tau,\tau).

The maximum (or least upper bound) \mathrm{B} of all numbers \beta=\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{-\sigma}^{\sigma}\left|\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}e^{- \mathrm{i}t\omega}f(t)\mathrm{d}t\right|^{2}\mathrm{d}\omega taken over all f\in L^{2}(-\infty,\infty) subject to \int_{-\infty}^{\infty}|f(t)|^{2}\mathrm{d}t=1,\int_{-\tau}^{\tau}|f(t)|^{2}\mathrm{d}t=\alpha, for (fixed) \Lambda_{0}<\alpha\leq 1 , is given by \operatorname{arccos}\sqrt{\mathrm{B}}+\operatorname{arccos}\sqrt{\alpha}= \operatorname{arccos}\sqrt{\Lambda_{0}}, or equivalently, \mathrm{B}=\left(\sqrt{\Lambda_{0}\alpha}+\sqrt{1-\Lambda_{0}}\sqrt{1-\alpha} \right)^{2}.
The corresponding function f is given by f(t)=a\phi_{0}(t)\chi_{\tau}(t)+b\phi_{0}(t)(1-\chi_{\tau}(t)),a=\sqrt{\frac{\alpha}{\Lambda_{0}}},b=\sqrt{\frac{1-\alpha}{1-\Lambda_{0}}}.
For further information see Frieden (1971), Lyman and Edmonson (2001),Papoulis (1977, Chapter 6), Slepian (1983), andSlepian and Pollak (1961).
